intro: Astephanus dregei, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces strap-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Astephanus dregei is also noted for its resilience to coastal conditions and salt spray.
